description:
Awesome during the week, especially during NBA basketball season - they have EVERY channel possible and lots of HD tv's. Plus a punching bag boxing game, a basketball shooting game, darts and shuffle board. The bartenders are always super friendly, too. Prices are about the same as other SF bars. $5 beers, etc. 

Minus one star due to the douche bag frat guys come here before they head to the Marina on the weekends.
author: Teresa D.

description:
My girlfriend and I needed a spot to watch the Golden State Warriors game. Stopped by The Wreck Room on Thursday, May 24th around 6pm. Luckily, we beat the crowd as we were able to find two seats at the bar.

We both ended up doing four rounds of Coors Light (the tall cans) and Jameson neat. Not sure how we each managed to finish 96oz of beer in a little over two hours, but the game wasn't going well, so maybe we were trying to numb the pain? The whiskey pours were good. I'm more of a liquor than beer drinker, so when my gf ordered us the beers, I needed to add the Jameson.

The atmosphere here was great. Plenty of TVs for viewing the game. The bartenders are also super sweet. Very friendly and attentive. They just kept the rounds coming. It is a little dark and loud in here, but that's part of the charm of being at The Wreck Room.

My gf loves this bar and I can see why. Great place to grab some drinks while catching a game.
author: Elena N.

description: Best Bar Ever! The bartenders are amazing and  always accommodating. They are not known for flights, but they will make it happen. Great for sporting events. Evan makes the best drinks. Scotty has the best hair. Phil has the best playlist. Dave is the nicest. Women's bathroom is the best for selfies. All in all top notch customer service and fun atmosphere.
author: Dee B.

description: I really like this bar! I love the music they play and I think it is spacious enough that I don't feel as claustrophobic as I can in many SF bars. Bartenders are always pretty nice too!
author: Mariam P.

description:
+1 Games (skee ball, hoops, darts, punching bag, shuffleboard)
+1 Cheap drinks

-1 Dirty and smelly! Especially if you're by the darts area near the bathroom. My friends and I were playing darts for a while and the whole time I kept getting hit by waves of sewage/trash stink! I get that it's a dive bar but still...
author: Tina H.

description: Love this place. Always a good go to if ur w buddies and wanna drink and play some good ole ski ball. Bar tenders are nice too. Gets pretty crowded on weekends (not all tho) so my favorite time to go is when I can play ALL the games (ski ball, basketball hoop game, shuffle board, darts, pool) w no line. Big place w a juke box. 4 stars cuz its a bit grungey clean wise if ur all hoitey toitey like that
author: Jenna M.

description: I'm not a bar person but the company I work for had a "Staff Fun Day" for us and it was indeed fun. The Bartender made a Peach Lemonade for me with Peach Absolut....omgosh...so delicious..and the music playlist had my naughty side wanting to dance. Also forgot to mention that the atmosphere was friendly, and as far as bars go, this place was very clean inside! Much nicer than some restaurants!
author: Sakkara C.

description: Went in for the first time last night. The bartender was super friendly & the place was super clean. You usually expect a bar to be a bit messy. Spent hours playing ski ball & basketball game they have in there. I'd definitely recommend it for people who just want to grab a quick drink after work.
author: Quinn T.

description:
Yes, I read the 1 & 2 star reviews along with many 5 stars.  My experience was top-notch. This despite using a Broke-Ass Stuart coupon  from his 30 beers for $30.00 booklet. At the Wreck Room it's good up to an $8.00 beer!  

Scotty is a Great Guy! Excellent Bartender! Drank my beer, then a Car Bomb! Guinness, Jameson & Bailey's. Terrific!  I'm 71, no 20-something but get around. At Zeitgeist now! Hope Scotty doesn't mind the pics. Had a fine time.
author: Joshua C.

description:
I don't think I'd return to this bar. There wasn't anything inherently wrong with it, but if a bar in a city like San Francisco is just, "meh," then there really isn't any point in returning. 

I approached the bar and asked for a glass of water; the bartender grunted and indicated a cooler of ice water and plastic cups. I thanked him and poured myself a cup. A barback then says, "No, no, that's bad water." And he hands me a glass of ice water. he personally poured. At this point, I'm thankful for the water but also a little weirded out, because I don't know if something is in the water, or which cup. Everything was fine - the glass of water the barback kindly provided was totally normal. Still, not exactly a bar experience one wants to have.

As others have mentioned, the staff start closing down at 1:30 am. My experience on a Friday night was no different.
author: Sarah B.

description: Dive-y bar near Polk street -- Let your 20+ something self meet your arcade-game loving inner child. Cheap-ish drinks for the city (coffee stout is ) with skee ball, pool, shuffle board,  and some hoops. Bring some dollar bills if you want to shoot some hoops or play skee ball! Weekdays are more pleasant if you want to avoid crowds.
author: wendy q.

description:
I can't thank Scotty, Evan, and the whole crew enough for making my event a success at The Wreck Room!

We contacted them about 2-3 weeks in advance about reserving some space in their bar for a season finale watch party for the Syfy show 'Wynonna Earp'. From the beginning, they were beyond helpful in making every thing work out. They reserved several tables in "the cave" corner of their bar with two TVs for my group. When I had some concerns about making sure we could actually hear the TVs, Scotty and Evan made sure to accommodate all of my concerns. 

We had a turn out of about 23 people for my event and the whole staff made my group feel welcome and were so enthusiastic about making our experience unforgettable. 

We will definitely be coming back here to hang out and hold future events!
author: Fatima P.

description: DO NOT COME TO THIS BAR. I came here over the weekend and bought a drink for my friend at the bar. I was sober, closed my tab, received the receipt, signed it and tipped. I check my card and these a**holes added more of a tip than I gave them, an extra $8. How rude could you possibly be? Trying to scam people who come into the bar and buy drinks, hoping they don't pay attention or check their card later so they can screw them over. Unfortunately I didn't take my copy of the receipt cause who would have thought they would be so incredibly unprofessional. Do not come here.
author: Mia C.

description: Great place to play bar games and get cheap drinks on a weeknight. Gets pretty rowdy on weekends.
author: Mark D.

description:
I know, I know. I've been writing a lot of 5-star reviews. Maybe I've just been getting lucky and frequenting only great businesses...?

Oh, wait. Nope. I just remembered my experience at The Wreck Room.

Went on a Saturday night a couple of weekends ago for a friend's birthday and it was HOT inside. It felt like a vinyasa yoga class but with 100 bodies instead of 10. There's only one ceiling fan in there that's doing its best to circulate the air/sweat smells, but it's obviously not enough! My beer was also warm...

Come here on a cool (maybe even cold?) night or if you're already shit faced. Otherwise, you'll likely have a bad time.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
WOMEN PLEASE READ! FOR YOUR SAFETY! I am writing this review as I'm sitting in the bar. Me and my fiancé visited this establishment on 01-30-2017
@12am. We where playing darts right best to the restrooms when we noticed a man enter the men's restroom and promptly enter the women's restroom. 20 minutes had passed and I needed to use the restroom when my fiancé reminded me that the man was still inside the ladies room. I asked the Bouncer (shorter Mexican man with a brown hat) to check the restroom before I entered. The minute he walked into the women's bathroom this unknown man exited the stall. I promptly walked into the bathroom did my business and exited. As I'm exciting from the restroom to the dart playing area I notice the man ( who was in the women's restroom ) flipping off my fiancé. Seconds after he approaches me apologist saying he mistaken them and how sorry he is. My fiancé stepped in warning him to leave immediately. We left this bar feeling very uneasy and unsafe. The my was wearing a tight navy blue shirt with a black plain baseball cap on, I say him remove the baseball cap for a brief second revealing a receding hairline, he also had the look to him of maybe a handicap or Down syndrome man, but had the speech of a very well educated and social gentlemen. LADIES PLEAS WATCH OUT
author: Amanda G.

description:
The Wreck Room is a bar located near the intersection of California and Hyde straddling the northern border of Lower Nob Hill or, as many folks like to call this part of town, the Tendernob. North Carolina hometown buddy and now longtime San Francisco transplant Brian C introduced me to this spot.

The Wreck Room is like a college bar except it's in the middle of San Francisco. The Saturday night we went, the crowd appeared to be mostly twentysomethings. While the crowd was a little diverse, the atmosphere and vibe were predominantly fratastic. I can see why this place is popular. There are several TVs, great for watching sports. There's an old school CD jukebox. The highlight, though, is probably the assortment of bar games. They include:

- A pool table
- Basketball "Super Shot"
- Skee ball
- A boxing arcade machine with an actual punching bag
- One dart board
- One shuffleboard

Spacewise, the bar can seat about 20 customers. There are tall tables and bar stools in the front for about 20 more. Finally, there's a nook in the back with two tall tables and seating for another 20. The gaming area has a wide open space in the middle which is nice if you need breathing room. That is unless, of course, a dance party breaks out. The overall condition of the bar and games is alright. This place definitely has some years on it and, again, reminds me of a typical college town bar.

I can't say I enjoyed my time here because it was uncomfortably hot inside. It was an unseasonably warm upper 70s/lower 80s Fahrenheit day. Many older buildings in San Francisco don't have air conditioning. The Wreck Room is on the ground floor of what appears to be an older building, so I can't fault them too much. However, it doesn't change the fact that I wanted to leave solely because the heat was near unbearable (and I'm a warm weather person). It was also pretty busy that night, so the collective body heat, humidity, alcohol, and odor only made matters worse.

I'm sure The Wreck Room is more fun and entertaining on cooler nights.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Chill bar when it's not crowded and you want to play games. They have pool, skeeball, basketball, shuffleboard. Regular priced drinks.

It's annoying when it's super crowded though because it's very hot and sweaty inside, but it's a fun, popular bar.
author: Jenna G.

description: I set the quick shot basketball record at 83 but they didn't give the shirt for it... but still best night evvsss... #kblunts602 #eightythrizzle
author: Kevin B.

description: After reading the previous reviews, I was hesitant to come here for a work colleague's birthday. However, I had an amazing experience!!! To the point where I would love to host my own birthday here!  Went on a Saturday at about 3:30pm, and it was only a tad crowded. Vibe was fun and they were playing Hip Hop and R&B. Temperature was fine, not as hot and steamy as the other reviews mentioned. Bartenders were super attentive and friendly. Lots of tables to sit at and lots of space to stand around and chat. There's a basketball game, skee ball, and a pool table to keep yourself busy in your drunken stupor. I had a ton of fun and went to the Thai restaurant next door for drunchies after. I don't know, maybe I just came on a good day, but i had a ton of fun, will def come back (-:
author: Genevieve M.

description: Came here to watch the fight yesterday. Paid $30 to get in, but it included a free drink which was really cool. The bartenders were super chill & even hooked it up with a free drink. (Dude with the long hair & some Hispanic guy) They were on top of it & made sure everyone had a drink in their hand. We're from LA, but we'll definitely be back to visit!
author: Angelica C.

description: Nice ambiance really fun place strong drinks and they have a little game area pretty dope! Good music super fun with a large group of people. I highly recommend.
author: Shantae E.

description:
Scotty and his crew are the best!  I love this bar.  This place brings me back to my college days, but in a nice grown up way.  People are all fun and I love beating the guys in all the games.

Fun Fun!!!
author: Claire H.

description: Don't sell me a drink at 1:29am and ask me to leave your bar at 1:35am to "ensure you close by 2". You are legally obligated by your business hours to be open until 2am. If you do not want to be open at 1:40 then close at 1:30am. All of the staff was incredibly rude to me and did not apologize for any inconveniences. I will not be returning.
author: Amanda F.

description:
I love everything about this bar. Cheap drinks? Yep. Games like shuffleboard, darts, pool, skeeball and some being free (ahem, shuffleboard, and it's a nice table)? Yep. Great bartenders? Yep. My guy would add that they seem to be NY sports fans to boot.

Honestly, what more do you want in a bar. Sunshine? I'll give it up, this spot is dark, but it's a diveyeque sports bar with loads of flat screens! It also happens to be pretty spacious, making it a perfect spot for my friend's birthday. I got my buzz on off two deliciously strong and cheapish cocktails (I wanna say the $7-8 range), lost in shuffleboard and had a great time.

No food, but I'm sure you can bring some in? (Don't quote me on that last part). A great spot to spend the night or just pre-game before hitting up one of the more fanciful restaurants in Nob Hill!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Rude workers & bouncer. Rang the bell for last call at 1:30 and told people to chug their drinks because they want to go home. A friend of mine said "you guys don't close until 2". The bouncer proceeded to say "we close whenever we want". No. You close at 2. Don't try and kick us out 30 min early because you want to go home. You chose to be a bartender at this place knowing you work late. Terrible experience.
author: Sabrina M.

description:
I honestly am not sure if this is a bar with cool games or just a converted dudes gym locker room stuffed full of enterprise tech sales bros. If another person compares their air hockey game to the number of leads they qualified at work, then I am going to lose it.

Seriously, when I walked in here at 11pm, the entire place was humid and smelled like a wrestler's jock strap. Plus, the ratio was so heavily skewed in favor of men that I thought I was in the castro.
author: Andy J.

description: The bar was cool but the employees was extremely rude.  I understand last call was at 130 but don't rush everyone to purchase a drink before last last and expect Everyone leave the bar at 140 before you close .Which is stated on your website that you close at 2am .I was trying to play a game and an employee told me to go fuck myself after I asked him what time the bar closes.  Then I checked with a bartender and I asked again "what time do you close " and he said "we like to close early".  If that's the case change your business hours ...
author: Brandon C.

description:
I did NOT enjoy this place at all. Sorry, I hate to be the barer of bad reviews, especially since I spent the weekend with several other Yelpers discussing bad reviews and the implications that they have on business owners (who are trying their hardest to do their best) but I believe that low star reviews are acceptable if they help business owners learn what they can do better and aren't just merely bitch fests. So here's my attempt at not being a bitch:

While the drinks were cold and the price point was right ($5 for a Guinness Blonde) the heat inside the establishment killed the whole mood. While the Wreck Room was busy it certainly was not packed, however despite this it felt like a million degrees in here. Even sipping an ice cool beer did not help and it honestly killed the vibe for my party of six who quickly finished our first (and last) drinks and decided to move on. We were told about the Wreck Room from a local and were excited to play the games but the heat just killed it. 

I'm not sure what the air conditioning situation is (or if there even is any - I only noticed a large fan in the corner doing the best it cold) but if this could get sorted out the Wreck Room could be a cool place - for now however I would simply pass on it.
author: Zoie H.

description:
Pretty laid back bar. Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was fairly empty. It was nice because there was enough space to walk and talk to others without having to yell. 

It has a pool table, skeeball, shuffleboard, darts and a couple other games. The music consists of an old school jukebox so the music selection varies. Drinks are strong and cheap so beware. 

The crowd is diverse and friendly so that's always a plus. Will be coming back to this place!
author: Daisy B.

description:
Games, shots, and more games! Who wouldn't like it? 

Been here a couple times and had a great time at both.  The bartenders have always been exceptionally friendly - gave us shots on the house for my friend's birthday as well as extra large drinks for the birthday boy free of that extra charge.  Talk about service! 

It's a nice space to come with friends for some drunken games.  They've got pool, basketball, punching things (sorry...not eloquent) and some more arcade games.  Again - what's not to love with games and alcohol?
author: Steph S.

description: Look....wreck room was a WRECK ROOM! I can't even give it a star. That's how bad it was. I would like it to have at least an arcade room instead of just one freakin game corner. Next time, don't lie to us about how fantastic this bar is. because ITS NOT! but bartenders were nice.
author: Jessica B.

description: Evan at the wreck is coolest guy ever. Great service, great beer,great food and great atmosphere. Tv's for sports, punching bag game, cornhole, pool, basketball shot game and it's not packed on a Sunday while the sharks are playing in the finals? Solid spot to go,period.
author: Kevin S.

description: For Me The Wreck Room Is Like Coming Home . It's Loud , Crazy At Times But Always Fun . The Brothers  Evan & Scott Never Left New York , They Brought It With Them To The West Coast ...
author: Gregory P.

description: This place is a great stop in an evening of bar hopping. There are televisions, games, decent music, and seating around the large bar--something for everyone. They played a wide variety of songs from hip hop to Backstreet Boys (fun when you're drinking, especially to watch others sing their hearts out). They had a menu of about 8 unique specialty drinks, which we all enjoyed. I told the bartender that I liked one of them and asked which of the others were similar (sweet, fruity). She made something up for me and it was so good! Love that the bartenders are fun and approachable.
author: Susan G.

description: Came here one night to celebrate a friends birthday. Turned out to be a pretty awesome night. Great place to grab drinks, play some games, and hang out. The bartenders were really nice and attentive. Definitely a great spot to go to if you're ever in the city.
author: Jerry C.

description:
Great location, and great place to get "Wreck"ed, for real. However, it gets incredibly hot with a lot of younger fratty type crowds. Loved it when I was a bit younger, but unable to handle it now. You'll sweat profusely!

As for the games, the shuffleboard, skeeball, and other games are awesome. Great place to go on a more quiet night (avoid Fri/Sat). 

Prices on drinks are very reasonable. Still a great place to visit!
author: Albert K.

description:
With so many bars littered across SF, it's a shame that more aren't like The Wreck Room (or Buckshot on Geary).  That's not to say they're the best the city has to offer (though they are pretty good); rather, it's just that it'd be nice to have more places with this kind of entertainment!  Seriously, why can't more places offer shuffleboard??

As the name suggests, The Wreck Room offers plenty of games to entertain drinkers and non-drinkers alike.  In addition to shuffleboard, there's also skeeball, hoop shot, a boxing machine, darts, a pool table, and more.  In a way, they're like the D&B of bars, minus the food, overpriced drinks, and ticket arcade machines.

What makes The Wreck Room even better though is that the bartenders/staff are friendly and decently generous with their pours.  I can't say I was unhappy with my Makers Mark neat, nor with my pint of Shocktop.  It's just too bad they don't serve food like Buckshot, though people might never have a reason to leave then.

Since we were here for a meet up on a Wednesday night, I can't say how things are on a normal weekend, but I did see some of the "bro crowd" others have mentioned.  Still, the vibe felt pretty chill and not nearly as bro-ish as notorious spots like Bar None in the Marina.  Just make sure to Uber/Lyft/cab your way over here.  Beyond the obvious reason of not drinking and driving, parking in the area is terrible.
author: Mike L.

description:
My friends and I come here for the Oregon football games and love it. The bartenders have always been super friendly (especially Evan) and set the perfect mood for watching a college game. Somewhat reminiscent of Taylor's for fellow ducks. 

Super fun place that I would definitely recommend checking out for game days!
author: Karen R.

description:
The bartenders are not just good bartenders but also spectacular people.  They're the kind of guys you should want to know.  I now come here more than I go to R Bar just because it's closer to my home so I'm glad the bartenders work at both bars or else I'd still be walking 5 extra blocks to get to R Bar.  

Anyway, other than my love for the bartenders... it's big, there's a pool table, shuffle board, TVs, a dart board, and some other games to play.  The ladies bathroom is also one of the nicest bar bathrooms I've ever been in.  How often are their 3 bathroom stalls in a bar in SF?  

And if you haven't seen the new shirts... they are amazing.  Wreckognize.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Wreck Room has lost its soul and it makes me depressed.

I used to come here weekly when I lived in Nob Hill 2--3 years ago. It was the perfect place on the weekdays - 20 people max in the bar, Biggie and Dre bumpin' on the speakers, friendly staff, and great games to play - an amazing place to relax, talk, and dance if you wanted to. On the weekends, the Marina invaded, so this was a place to avoid.

I came back last night, a Thursday, for the first time in a year or two and was shocked. What used to be Dre and Biggie is now Fifth Harmony, Ed Sheeran, and EDM tunes. They upgraded with a bunch of new TVs, which is cool, and got rid of the jukebox. Games are still around and staff is still awesome but it just didn't feel the same. They are definitely catering towards a new audience of more yuppies (probably from the Marina). 

I knew it was time to go when a group of young professionals created a circle of awkward dancing to Maroon 5. I guess this review isn't meant to reflect badly upon Wreck Room, because they have to make their money, but this place just isn't the same and it's a reflection of the shifting of culture/make up in the city.
author: Howard C.

description:
Wreck Room is a dive-y bar in the Tendernob, with plenty of games to wait in line for. 

The crowd is primarily college age, as well as 30-something girls who still wear plastic crowns on their birthday.



The drinks are cheap, and it's in a great area if you're crawling the bars of Polk street. Bring cash, otherwise you'll be stuck getting a second drink here or using their ATM.
author: William M.

description: Bartenders were friendly and awesome, they air all the football games and have fun games, what more could you ask for!?
author: Megan E.

description:
It can get serious when it comes to drinking and playing in this spacious Wreck Room!

It is a fun bar room that offers a pool table, shuffle board, mini basketball, arcade game  section, darts and skeeball.

Definitely an entertaining room to hit up if you haven't done so before.  When it comes to playing the shuffle board and having a few beers in you, people can be quite competitive.  Be careful!  It might just become a Wreck Room, indeed!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
SF should have more bars like this!

The Wreck Room has skeeball, hoops, darts, pool, shuffleboard and more to keep me entertained. Will definitely come back.

Also located next to one of my favorite bars, Soda Popinski's!
author: Christine C.

description: Holy Jets fans!  This seems like an East Coast Bar, so its cool with me.  Too crowded and too crazy for me as a recovering East Coaster and former Giants Fan.  If you want a dive bar experience, this is a great place.
author: James D.

description:
Let me start off with this: sticky floors.

A locals dive?  I definitely didn't get that vibe.  (Look at me rhyme!)  It was like a college party so I guess if you're looking for that kind of environment, come here!  However, I got the impression that not all of the patrons were college students, just acting like it, which is possibly worse.

I'm glad there was no cover and the various games throughout the area was cute, but there also was no space to sit or even lean, so I ended up just standing in the middle on the room, avoiding being bumped into.  The people there were pretty rude/unfriendly/hostile, unless they were trying to hit on girls.

Their dark and stormy was so awful, and I'm not even a picky drinker.  We ended up downing the drink and leaving.  

Maybe another time, when there are, you know, no people.
author: Janet L.

description: Great little bar with some skee-ball, basketball, pool, and other fun bar games.  The drink specials are really great and the ambiance is awesome.  Came here with a relatively large group (~10 people) and had tons of fun.  I definitely recommend the beer and shot special.  Would recommend you to come try this place out if you are in the area.
author: Richard L.

description: Evan and his New York boys are awesome! My wife is a jets fan and felt right at home here for Sunday NFL football. They even made free appetizers between games. Great drinks and a great tim
author: Joe L.

description: I love this place, it is the perfect place to watch sport with friends whilst shooting hoops, playing pool and mastering the art of shuffle board. Shuffle board is totally addictive for any of you who have not tried it... a very simple and fun game. What i love about this place is not only the fun laid back atmosphere but the fact you can also bring your own food as they don't serve food. You can rock up with a pizza and no one blinks an eye lid... LOVE IT! If you are new to SF this is also a good place to meet people as everyone is really friendly.
author: Nicola T.

description:
Great dive bar with a little Dave and Busters action with the games they have. The bartenders work their tails off and I've never had to wait too long for a drink. Gets crowed on the weekends but the crowd is usually better than the typical Polk Street crowd down the street. 

Also a great place to watch games. Have to say though, and the owners may not enjoy this, but it turns into a Jets bar on NFL Sundays. Me and my buddies (49er's fans) enjoy going down and watching them drown in their misery when the Jets blow it. Either way great bar.
author: Kyle F.

description: Wreck room was my favorite bar I went to in San Francisco!  The staff was super friendly & fun, made us feel right at home!  Drinks were very reasonably priced from what we saw compared to other bars in the area.  We had planned on bar hopping that night with the Wreck Room being our 3rd stop, we enjoyed ourselves so much we ended up staying there the whole night!!  Thanks so much to the Allstar Wreck Room staff!
author: Natasha P.

description:
Cool bar. I met up with some friends who were visiting from SD to grab a drink and catch up. The bar tender is cool and had me try Palm after I ordered a Stella. I felt bad for only having a credit card on me and ordering one drink... SORRY! 

It's a cool venue with a pool table, basketball arcade game, skeeball, and shuffleboard. On a Tuesday night, it was pretty quiet, but I'd come back if I were in the area!
author: Leana L.

description:
Reminiscent of a beta Golden Gate Tap Room on Sutter Street.

The Wreck Room has its charm with its pool table, shooting hoop, and cool bar space. I would recommend this place for HH or great meet up with friends before heading out to the city.
author: C M.

description:
The Good
- Spacious sports bar
- Darts, Shuffleboard, Electronic Basketball, Punching bag
- A fair amount of TV's for sports
- A decent selection of local beers on tap for a decent price
- Attentive bar staff makes it easy to order drinks

The Bad
- It would be nice if they served some food
author: Dipesh G.

description:
In my book, the Wreck Room is a 4 on a not-crazy-busy night but just a 3 on its super busy nights. Unfortunately it seems somewhat hard to predict which Friday's and Saturday's will be okay versus crazy packed. Here's out it breaks down: 

+ pop-a-shot, pool table, and shuffle board
+ some yummy cocktails for reasonable prices such as a great $7 Moscow Mule
+ several beers on tap
+ not cash only
- on the super busy nights, it can take 20+ minutes to get a drink and the bar turns into a mob
+ there is a random side section where you can have a party and bring in outside food - think: pizza
- the bar doesn't feel super clean especially on those busy busy nights

When this bar first opened, it was so raved about (especially because of all the games such as pop-a-shot) that I expected even more but, overall, it's a pretty good bar!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Darts?  Check.  Shuffleboard?  Check.  Billiards?  Check.  Arcade basketball?  Check.  Skeeball?  Check.  Friendly bartenders?  Check.  What more can you ask for?

After a lot of back and forth discussion, my friends and I decided to venture out to the Nob Hill area on a Thursday night.  Surprisingly, it wasn't that crowded which was fine by us.  Just a fun divey bar to hang out, knock back a few beers with friends, and enjoy the fun times.  Definitely will be a regular go to place for me in the future.
author: Kevin C.

description:
I like this place. I love sports and I love having something to do such as play games when I'm at a bar. They have a few pool tables, darts, shuffle boards, ski-ball, and some other games to play. 

What I really liked about this place is the crowd. Younger crowd our age and its usually pretty full but not TOO full like mcteagues. Have been here a handful of times, and will be back again.
author: Erin J.

description:
You're going to find a very non-diverse and older crowd, country music, and some games in the back. The bartender and bouncers are nice enough, but nothing too special. Came here on a Friday night, but was pretty bored after a couple of hours.

The drinks are cheap and strong -- they don't skimp.

Parking in Nob Hill is a complete pain in the ass, so it's not worth coming here if you're driving. Definitely catch an uber/lyft and let yourself go.
author: Davinci L.

description:
The Wreck Room is a great place to visit on a week day evening.  The games are free & it's not crowded.

During the weekend, however, it's a complete sh*t show. It's so crowded that it'll take you 40 minutes just to get a drink, it's so stuffy and hot (which makes it difficult to breathe), and it's full of drunk douchebags.  There are much better bars nearby on the weekends.
author: Grace C.

description:
Is kinda meh about this place. The floor is sticky like an overused frat house. But overall, I'd guess its a bout a 3.5 kind of place. I can't bump it up to a 4.

Coming in here, you honestly feel like you stepped into either a frat house, or people who just moved beyond the frat. Plaid shirts everywhere. Was there a dress code for guys?? Because 80% of you were wearing a plaid shirt. Or a Northface jacket. Dear god, is this what SF style has become!?

Drinks are pretty decent here, and the bartenders attentive. I find it odd that they just have a cooler of water sitting on the bar for people...mostly because people hang out right in front of it. Seriously. This is not Monday morning at your office. Some people need water when its a crowded bar. When I say "excuse me, can I get to the water" it does not mean "I'm just going to move behind you real quick."  Its a "move your ass so I can get to the water!" 

Me: if I spilled water on you, its your own fault
Douche: Its ok, I have a waterproof jacket. 

Ok...so you've done this before. Is it your way to pick up chicks? Cause...you're really just a douche in the way.

The crowd here is a bit random. A few overly drunk folks that make the place more interesting. Some people who decide to start dancing and making their own dance floor. A few nice people who will humor my randomness at flinging my friends into their group and demanding that they talk to her (because its her birthday, damnit!). In general, the guys here know how to be nice and talk to a female, so it's always a bonus. Not a creeper bar (yay!)
author: Lily W.

description:
This si a solid 3.5star  bar.  A nice chill local place.

This place is a nice sports bar.  We all wanted to just stop in for a quick drink between dinner and another place we had a long walk to.  My freind and I enjoyed some fine craft beers, and the bartender did a fine job making cocktails for our wives.  They wanted sangria, butthe bar didn't have it.  But, he made an approximation of it using brandy, fruit juices and some other elements.  They were quite pleased with the results.  The bartender was simply excellent.

The place is very casual.
author: Andy R.

description:
ATMOSPHERE:
I love the wreck room! Basketball game, pool table what's not to love?? It's also on California St Nob Hill, so in the middle of seeing the Trolleys roll by. Also near Polk, so if you're in for a ratchet night hayy. All here for your easy drunken stumblings to!


8.13
author: Angela L.

description:
It's not fancy, or clean, or a place that you should bring a respectable date before 11 pm, but it has games and cheap drinks, so if you're looking to be entertained by both games and people watching, you'll have fun! 

A great neighborhood spot, Wreck Room has games ranging from digital basketball hoops or punching bags to old-school style darts and pool, so there's something for everyone with ADHD. Drinks are pretty cheap with heavy pours, and it's rarely crowded given the large size. 

One time, the basketball machine ate my dollar without giving me a game, and the bartender literally crawled under the machine, checked it out to see if he could fix it, and then gave me a dollar from his tip jar to compensate. 

This would be a good place to meet a group to pregame before going to a pricier bar nearby or to dinner, or to check out on a Sunday when you're bored.
author: Gabrielle H.

description:
Ehhhh not my favorite place but it was a going away party for a good friend. Maybe this place is more fun when there are less people there but it was crowded, you couldn't use any of the games and it just wasn't my crowd. 

They did have high or hell watermelon on tap, so cheers to that!
author: Aneilia M.

description:
I'm a little behind on my Yelping but I stopped in last weekend with my fiance and a friend for a quick celebratory drink. It was early-ish, probably 2pm? I know what you're thinking, and no, we don't care. It's 5 o'clock somewhere!

I'm not sure if it was because of the golf tournament or not, but the percentage of people in polos and khakis seemed pretty high for Nob Hill. But the atmosphere was good, drinks were cheap, and we had a good time. Would definitely return.
author: Rachel E.

description: Fun games, good times, and they held my backpack when I forgot it. 5 stars!
author: Kaivon A.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco from a huge college town in Kentucky, so I was looking all over for a place that would feel more comfortable for me as a college student. The atmosphere was great because there were more 20somethings and everyone was so laid back and friendly. The games in the place are a great way to break the ice with new people. It wasn't packed even though it was Friday night. Up by the bar gets a little more crowded but there's plenty of room once you step away from it. 
The bartenders were absolutely great as they were so attentive and always ready to make me a drink. Gabriel and Evan were serving me and I loved them both! Ethan, a bartender from R Bar, recommended I go here and I'm so glad I did.
author: Christen G.

description: Spent the weekend in SF for bay to breakers, came to this place every day. Great beer selection and the bartenders are awesome guys. Highly recommend.
author: Ryan B.

description:
This is a pretty cool bar with a jukebox, basketball hoop and shuffleboard in the back. The drinks are pretty stiff. I couldn't even finish one of the specials I ordered but then again, I'm a lightweight. We stopped here during BunnyCon so it was crazy busy inside. Not sure how it is on other days, but even during a Saturday, this place was wall to wall busy.

It took awhile to get served and the location is pretty decent. It gets crazy loud in here so if you don't like loud bars, then go elsewhere.
author: Amy J.

description: This place just feels like home. Great spot to watch sports, throw back some shots with friends, work outings or to just play some bar games. The bartenders are amazing. For big sporting events it can get packed, but mostly an easy spot to enjoy some cold ones.
author: Justin P.

description:
This spot is on fleek!!!! The drinks are potent. The games are fun! There are more than enough TVs to watch any sporting event at the same time. 

5/5 Would Come Back Again.
author: Rob G.

description: My husband and I were visiting San Francisco for the week and this was the perfect place to chill out, meet locals and play games. The drinks weren't fantastic but the staff was friendly and they had a nice selection of beer. It has a great atmosphere and super fun vibe.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Bar is pretty nice and well-stocked. The margaritas are strong enough and the drinks are decent. There are a lot of pool tables and games, so it is a great place to entertain a group of adults.

Except when it gets too crowded -- then it is really, really warm inside. So warm that we have to escape the place -- and this is during a cool winter night.
author: Alice C.

description: This place has become my stomping grounds. First bar to hit and possibly the last bar to stumble in. Good prices and even better bartenders. I loveeeee this place and I love Gabriel and Ethan (my new main squeezes). Definitely a bar I would recommend. Plus, they have games... wuuuuut.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
TV, got it!  They had this huge board with brackets.    

Boxing game, got it. Pool table, got one. Basketball hoop, got it too! Shuffleboard too.   I didn't see darts but then again, I wasn't trying to look for them.

Plenty of room to mingle/dance. 

Beers and hard liquors...decent pricing.  Bartenders, bunch of dudes, and they look like they can handle their liquors. ;-)
author: Fannie S.

description: It is almost always loud, but that's what you should expect for a bar. The pool tables in back normally have a wait but it's definitely a fun place to hangout.
author: Taylor L.

description: Good memory=Warriors winning the NBA tournament last week.  Insanity =trying to get myself up to where my friends were parked in an entirely packed space filled floor to ceiling (it seemed) with Warrior fans mid game.   Plenty of televisions for game watching, but perhaps next time I will arrive early and be prepared to squat!
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Skeeball, basketball, shuffleboard... I'm in!

Friendly bartenders and a fun crowd. Not too crowded on a Friday night (but just crowded enough to maintain friendly conversation with strangers).

Will be back :)
author: Michelle L.

description:
Wreck Room reminds me of Golden Gate Tap Room : shuffle boarding, skeeball, and lots of beer options. The crowd was mostly young 20 something Niners fan (Sunday Play off game) and not too crowded. Super easy to order a drink here or grab a table.

If you want a fun place to go, come to the Wreck Room.
author: Kelly C.

description:
There's plenty of cool stuff to do here and the drinks aren't half bad either.

Wreck Room has darts, skeeball, hoops, shuffleboard, etc., plenty to keep a group occupied and just about every game that's on TV playing. We were there on a Saturday night and hardly had to wait to play any of the games (leave an ID with the bartender) and there was no cover. It was nice to not be packed like a sardine into a bar.

It's mostly a standing type place with a few bar stools, so don't try here if you're looking for some quite conversation in a booth.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Great balls of fire!

This bar is pretty awesome. Discovered this place while on a beer crawl with the hubby.

The place is spacious and it's almost like a mini Dave & Busters with the pool table, shuffleboard and mini basketball hoop. They even allow your canine friend to join you if you have one.

When you're done playing games, jam out to the music. They play top 40 and classic hits like Beastie Boys and Michael Jackson. 

Refill at the bar when you're low on energy and booze. Take a seat and chat it up with one of the bartenders. They're all super chill and friendly, but Scotty was my fave. Chatting with him was super fun and he even gave us shots on Fireball Cinnamon Whiskey on the house! If you haven't had that whiskey before, you NEED to! Tastes just like the hot cinnamon candy you grew up with!

This bar is so much better than a lot of bars in the South Bay. And their drink prices are way more reasonable.  I definitely want to come back!
author: Daisy T.

description:
Wreck room used to be great. A local bar, not *too* crowded on the weekend, with bar games and a great jukebox.

Now It's where the marina goes on weekends when it wants a "dive" bar.

I can't tell you the amount of times men have pushed me on their way to slam their jager shots in their boat shoes and polos.

No thanks.
author: Jenny U.

description:
We had our Back to the Future party at the Wreck room yesterday, and the entire staff was just awesome.
The space was great too, because our party was slightly tucked away from the main crowd but able to spill out and not feel claustrophobic. We had about 25 people attend, and the area we were in felt just about right for that many people (could have had maybe 30, beyond that, a bit cramped).
HUGE shout outs to Evan, Ethan and Scott for taking care of our group despite a packed bar with people there to watch the game.
The drinks were all delicious (they made us some specialty cocktails) and totally reasonably priced. 
There isn't any food at the bar, but they are totally accommodating about your bringing in your own, and there is an area to set up that is away from the main crowd. 
I look forward to coming back in a more casual capacity, would love to get to play the games they have there :)
author: Vivian T.

description:
Sadly just getting around to writing this review. Open floor plan, can get packed sometimes ie Niners and UCLA games, but still a plenty of room for you to not have to stand and waddle around the bar like a penguin. Darts, basketball shuffle board and all the other typical bar games are here
The best part about the bar...Bartenders...the guys get you what you want quick and always provide healthy pours. They make the bar lively, play awesome music and have a jukebox as well if you decide the music isn't up to par.

Only downside....Tt started attracting the striped/plaid collared shirt, jeans and dress shoe marina type crowd, but it still brings in plenty of cool people.
author: Craig S.

description: They kicked us out before 2am. Why? And the dude hogged the basketball game for like 6 hours. Why.
author: Bradley C.

description:
what a wreck :(

Came Saturday night to go to Nob Hill Tavern Sports Bar (http://www.yelp.com/biz/nob-hill-tavern-sports-bar-san-francisco) which apparently is replaced by the wreck room.

I wanted to go somewhere cool and low key to play darts with my bf, but that didnt happen.

This place is so extremely loud and over crowded. people are shouting to have a conversation because the TVs are turned up WAY too loud. we got no more than 5 steps past the door and immediately left to go to the Hyde Out across the street (where we found lots of other people just as confused/ upset as us). oh and they stamp your hand with a black stamp. cant they just use blacklight ink so you don't walk around with your hand/ wrist looking like a canvas for clubs?
author: Kailey O.

description: Decent bar. Nothing very out of the ordinary. I really enjoyed my Dark n Stormy cocktail. It was pretty good (although my boyfriend disagreed). The prices are definitely steeper than I am used to, but they are a lot lower than the rest of San Francisco. I took off a star because I find it a little ludicrous that they are cash only when it is 2015.
author: M W.

description: I think the term 'sophomoric' was first created to adequately describe this bar. The crowd is usually pretty lame and sometimes agro. The bartenders are hit or miss and the drinks and beer selection are mediocre at best. Probably the worst (and most puzzling) thing about the Wreck Room is how crowded it can get on weekend nights. Nevertheless, it's around the corner from my apartment so I end up here from time-to-time sipping on a cheap drink.
author: Bobby N.

description:
Been meaning to write this review for a while!  My company recently threw a launch party at The Wreck Room, and it was FANTASTIC. 

When I called to see about renting a space, they recommended I reserve the back area of tables, which were free of charge. They got back to me quickly when I left messages, and were happy to answer any questions I had. 

We brought in a ton of food, put up decorations, and even set up a video game "arcade" to one of their TV's. Everyone there was extremely welcoming, accommodating, and fun to be around. Good drinks, fun games, plus excellent customer service made for a great night, and was definitely one of the best company parties we've had. They even offered to tear down the decorations afterwards! Thanks so much guys!!! You're the best!
author: Cake S.

description:
Great spot. A little sloppy, but good for a dive bar. love the games, especially shuffleboard

Bar staff is great too. Always creating a great atmosphere.
author: Jay G.

description:
Due to trying to avoid someone I can't go to Buckshot anymore, which at first I was bummed about.  But then I discovered Wreck Room and, as it turns out, it's WAY BETTER. Parking is balls, but totally worth it.  Or Sidecar it if you drink.

I'm ready to play skeeball RIGHT NOW.
author: Nora S.

description:
I can tell stories about my experiences at the Wreck room. Oh boy, can I.

But I won't, because Yelp reviews are not a place to describe drunken rants and embarrassing nights. I believe that site is called FML.

Anyways... back to describing the bar. It's actually a very cool concept: a barcade--full bar with plenty of games to keep you entertained.

A hoops machine.
A skiball machine.
A shuffleboard.
A pool table.
A punching bag.
Cheap drinks.
Good company.

What more do you need?

----- 

Distinguishing factor: A bar and arcade. All-round adult playpen.
author: Nick A.

description:
This place has some of the best cocktails I have ever tasted!

It looks kind of like a dive bar - surroundings are kind of old and unkempt, but I liked the music they played here (hip hop/top 40) and the skeeball/basketball games they had on the side. There is almost no sitting room though, so be prepared to stand around. The crowd is more of the college/fratty type. 

My favorite drinks were the peach lemonade and the cucumber sour. Both were only $7 for a pretty big drink. The bartenders are also super nice here. I would definitely come back!
author: Jenny M.

description: Don't usually like overly crowded bars... But it's hard to find anything other than an overly crowded bar in the Bay Area when the Warriors are in the NBA Finals. However, this place is pretty fantastic. Spacious. Plenty of TVs. The bartender made a great beverage (Cucumber Sour) despite being busier than ever and holding the fort down on his own . Can't really ask for a better experience.
author: Judi B.

description:
Sausage fest - probably 85% male gender.
Skeeball, basketball, darts, pool table, and fun games. 
DON'T DRINK THE DIRTY MARTINI, not fresh.
Really nice bartender, brunette woman. I enjoy going to this bar with friends, it's a great place for socializing and meeting new people.
author: Jenna P.

description:
In 2007, I was 22. In 2007, The Wreck Room would have been my favorite bar.

It has all the markings of a "Young Single Devon" hot spot:
- Tons of TBBB's (Tall Brunette Business Bros)
- Tons of beers on tap
- Tons of games and so much room for ACTIVITIES!
- An unmistakable whiff of "We are all here for the very same reason...booze, games, and phone numbers."  

But it's not 2007, it's 2012. My tastes have decidedly matured, and more importantly, I'm taken. When we stopped by this past weekend, my every-day-getting-closer-to-30 self felt super old and super not with it.

So it's time to pass the torch. 

It should be noted that the ladies are just as attractive as their male counterparts. My little brother, who just happens to be 22, is going to make a killing.
author: Devon S.

description:
Drinks are pretty affordable here. $5 for beer, $7 - $8 for hard liquor drinks depending on what you order. It's a spacious bar, filled with an assortment of games from shuffleboard , ski ball, and other options. The crowd here is a bit on the younger side, i.e. recent college grads, early to mid 20s would be my guess. 

Note: $10 minimum for credit card purchases.
author: Patty O.

description: This place is divey but very big and has a good amount of space as well as a pool table. This is a good spot to hit on the way to Polk street. Not a fave but will prob end up here again on another drunken occasion.
author: Brittini S.

description: Tons of fun little games to play here, it is a great place to hang out with friends and play some darts.  There are usually a lot of people here during the weekends, parking can be very difficult around the neighborhood, so maybe grab a lyft or uber would do the trick.  They serve a lot of drinks here and the bartenders are quick to your order, so have fun play some games and drink!
author: Danny C.

description:
I was hoping that someday someone would upgrade the old Nob Hill Sports bar and Grill.  I had a buddy that lived off california, and everytime we walked by there, we knew it was a gold mine - great open space, and a pretty decent location.... gotta get the old guy locals out of there, and upgrade the place a little... and BOOM, you gotta sweet hang out spot!

I don't think a lot of people know about it - but it's a great place to start off the night.  They've got hoops, pool table, shuffle board, 2-bars, and a ton of open space (TAKE THAT R-BAR!) If you're looking for a spot to watch the game, or a good time out, this place allows for all's enjoyment!
author: Ken T.

description: We happened onto this place on the weekend of the 4th, so it wasn't overcrowded, and therefor very fun.
author: N O.

description: Went here on a Tuesday night with a group of girlfriends. While it wasn't super busy, it was a really nice atmosphere and it was a great place to hang out on a weeknight. The bartender was very friendly and accommodating and the overall vibe of the place was casual and comfortable. I'll definitely go back.
author: Lori M.

description:
There are four things that make this bar a win in my book:

1) Never overly crowded
2) Bar games -- including newly installed skeeball!
3) Cheap drinks
4) Nice bartenders

It's also conveniently located on Polk.
Great place for happy hour.
author: Roxane W.

description:
The other reviews give the low down about what they've got here; the games, no food, etc..

I want to express my affection for The Wreck Room as I haven't experienced a place like this in SF yet...

I walked in to a busy bar and sat down.  I was almost immediately greeted kindly by a nice lady bartender.  That alone!  (To the rest of SF bartenders:  PLEASE TAKE NOTE!)  The whole night she was conscious of the drink level for my friend and I and swiftly took care.  I seriously almost want to make a batch of cupcakes and bring them to her just so she knows how awesome she is!

I noticed a very high volume of young men in there.  Every body seemed respectful and mostly under control.  One guy drop and broke a glass-at most bars the bartenders might throw an exasperated fit but no, The Wreck Room crew was like, 'Whatevs-ain't no thing.'  

People made conversation with strangers.  Others rooted each other on playing games.  The vibe was awesome and I will definitely be back!
author: Ashley W.

description:
We went here for the first time on a Wednesday night. We had...a blast! Since not too many people were in, we pretty much had the run of the place. Between the darts, billiards, shuffleboard, and drink specials, we had a great time. Not to mention, you can order Thai Thai Noodle for dinner which is right across the street. 

I would give Wreck Room 4.5 stars for not having their own food, but picky can't be choosy!
author: Amanda E.

description: Whoa baby, such a great bar. Great drinks, great specials, great staff and a great experience. Life is what you make it and our friends at Wreck Room make it happen. Come here for a memorable experience.
author: Chris K.

description:
This is your "bro" bar.

No DJ (music comes from a jukebox), lots of beer on tap (pretty cheap), a dartboard, a pinball machine (which to my memory, claimed to be busted by my friend, as she screamed obscenities to the machine), pool table, and a moving basketball board. Kind of sounds like a neighborhood Dave and Busters without the food.

Only big gripe about the place is that in some areas of the bar the floor was REALLY sticky. Eww. 

Otherwise, enjoyable. Come at me, bros.
author: Gene P.

description:
Came here last night as my friends and I were starting are second leg of a binging spree.  A tuesday night of all nights, althouth it was Fat Tuesday.  Doesn't look like much from the outside, but once you step in, you are treated to spacious bar with a pool table and plenty of bar games around.  You then realize the cleverness of the name a Recreation room where you can get wrecked! Love it.

The place was spacious, the bartenders were all nice and attentive (hard to find nowadays), and the games were fun.  I owned the Hot Shots Basketball game that night.  Plenty of flat screen TV's show various sports programming.

The place is still new so it still has a nice clean feel to it.  Almost like the bar area of a chain restaraunt or something like that.  I'm sure after a year of partying and hard-drinking the place will start to look edgier!

I really hope this place survives and becomes a mainstay in the city.  And I hope they keep the Hot Shots Basketball game in good condition!
author: Veasna H.

description:
College!!!! This place is great if you are 24 and looking for a very college-feel type bar thats slightly over priced. Pretty crowded on big college football games.

I gave it 4 stars only because they have skiball, shuffleboard, and a couple other video games. Decent beer selection. Otherwise 3 stars.
author: Braden B.

description: This was a cool laid back place to be. Has a jukebox and lots of games to play. A good spot for beers and catching up. The crowd is definitely a bunch of irritating frat boys screaming over the skee ball, getting crazy. A little dramatic. The bartender isn't the friendliest. We ended up leaving and going to another place down the street. I wouldn't come back just because the crowd is annoying. Spacious though.
author: Natasha S.

description:
It was the end of the 3rd quarter when we finally decided we were done at Hillstones, since watching a soundless playoff game on a small flat-screen TV there was not cutting it.  So we all decided to go to a real sports bar.  I opted "No to the marina"... only because I've been there non-stop lately.  Despite the fact that my ulterior motive was the proximity of this bar to my place, I'm grateful that they agreed to my suggestion.  I've only been here once before... and I still haven't checked out the back area of the bar where the game room area is... pool table, basketball hoop machine...

But it literally is like night and day when you compare watching the game on a small soundless tv lacking the ambiance of true locals boisterously cheering for their team that was losing in the beginning of the game but are miraculously coming back. The stereo surround  sound of multiple large screen flat TVs with fan-filled excitement in the air... it was the perfect environment to watch the Warriors come back and beat the Nuggets last night at Oracle arena!  What's cool is that the Warriors are a fairly young team... so by 2017 when the new stadium opens in the city... they should all be in their prime!
author: Myra M.

description: Cool bartenders, decent beer selection and a lot of fun games make the Wreck Room a great place to hang out with friends!! The place is good-sized, especially in the back, so even with a ton a people there you don't feel cramped. Had a lot of fun there with some friends!
author: Devin A.

description:
11.23.11 || bookmarked 02.16.11

Hosted my birthday party here and had a blast, from what I could remember.

We had the side room reserved, but it wasn't utilized due to all the fun that the groups had in the main room.  Billiards, shuffle board, darts, etc.

Wish I wasn't so busy drinking.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Wreck Room, you could be so much cooler! 

I live a few blocks away from this bar, and the others on nearby Polk Street, so I'm kind of spoiled when it comes to drinking options. When a buddy of mine told me that Wreck Room had arcade basketball, I had to go. He even said it was such a great place that I could make it "my bar." Very enticing. 

If I only ever went to Wreck Room during the day, he might have been right. Drinks are well priced, although limited in selection. It's average in every sense of the word. But, there's one thing about the Wreck Room that knocks off a few stars for me: the crowd. If you're looking for BRO CITY, you'll love this place.

As soon as I walked in, I could tell that I was going to be annoyed with the rest of the crowd. I'm pretty sure my friends and I were the only ones in the bar that weren't wearing Greek letters on our undershirts. But hey, if you're into hanging out with tools amping themselves up while trying to impress girls by getting the high score on the punching bag game, go to Wreck Room. You'll love it.
author: Billy B.

description: Amazing customer service!! Strong drinks too;) love it here i will be back thank you so much. Great valentines day:)
author: Tara J.

description:
For a bar experience I guess this place is fine. Don't expect anything fabulous or fancy. If you purely want to get wasted or pre-party with a ton of alcohol, it might be a good choice for you. On the other hand, if you want to grab a few drinks and chit chat with your friends I would not come here again. The music sometimes gets way too loud, you can hardly hear yourself, sorry but there is no chance for normal conversations. The place is kind of dirty and old school. 
The only fun thing here is the punching machine in the back.
author: Anita D.

description: One of my favorite bars in SF for Niners or Warriors games! Evan & Scotty are the best bartenders and take great care of everyone. Cheap beers + TONS of seating (rare and awesome!) + fun games for halftime and postgame. Doesn't get any better!
author: Kelly B.

description: Such a fun place! I love bar games and this place has skeeball, darts, a basketball game and more. Great drink specials and just plain affordable drinks. Just watch out for the weekend night crowd, it can get pretty douchey when the marina BROS show up. But for an early evening hand out or a pregrame spot its great.
author: Katelin N.

description: My fav bar hands down. Everytime I go there I get baileys then I head over to the popshot machine and kill it. My bf and I go there on Thursdays to chill with a coupla of friends. They have a pool table and shuffle board too. Popshot anyone?
author: Jennie C.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, it has such good potential. 

Yea....I wouldn't come back. I will accept it was a Sunday night, which is probably why it was so dead, but it just didn't do it for me. Definitely a Bros bar as others have said, and the bartenders were cool, but honestly even with all the games, etc. It just sucked, we ended up leaving. By the end of the night, the bartender was more drunk than we were, making out with some bar fly at the end of the bar. He ended up cutting himself on something, was bleeding everywhere and super glued the cut shut, YIKES. 

2 stars for the drinks, those were some big shots and strong drinks for a very decent price.
author: Shannon O.

description:
During a visit to the city my GF and I met up with an old friend of mine. We decided to meet up at Wreck Room. 
I shouldn't complain about parking because it is expected not to find any in the city - but for some reason this time it was more difficult.

The bar was packed! It reminded me of college and being at a frat party at a frat house. A bunch of bros and their chicks watching them play arcade like games. Back when I was 21 I would have loved this place. But I'm not, so I don't.

I was looking for more of a dive bar environment.
The bartender was nice and we met some chill guys there - everyone seemed like they were having a blast - just not my style anymore. 
I would go back, but it wouldn't be my first choice. 

We had one beer and left...on to the next!
author: Royce S.

description:
SUNDAY FUNDAY!! 

Skeeball. Darts. Pool. PUNCHING MACHINE. This place is filled with epic games when intoxicated. Drinks are cheap, bartender is nice. This place is pretty damn fun.... especially when people miss the punch at the punching machine... bahahahaha

I like this place because it's not dirty and run down like the other polk st bars. It's got a clean bar, clean floors, clean bathrooms... but unfortunately dirty people since my guy friends were there. 

Thank you wreck room for making my sunday so fun.
author: Emily T.

description: Love this place. Great ambiance and they have games to play so it's not just a bar. They have pool, darts, shuffleboard & you can shoot Hoops on an arcade type of game.
author: Jency D.

description:
After reading all of the previous reviews, i get it, i get it people. You can shut up. NO ONE LIKES MARINA KIDS. that's a give in. But honestly, don't give a bad review to a place just because some marina douche bags mad dogged you and you feel entitled to punish them via posting a yelp review to make you feel better.
This place is actually really fun. Talk to the bartenders, they are attentive and full of knowledge. Maybe learn about a new spirit. 
I see people sulk in the corner while finishing their beer just because there are a group of obnoxious boys playing on the basketball hoop.


Get over yourself and enjoy your damn beer and shot.
author: Sami B.

description:
this place reminds me the most of some dive / beach bars in san diego.

i wasn't here long enough to get a drink or anything so i can't tell you much about it

the only reason i'm writing this review is to say that THEY HAVE SHUFFLEBOARD which is an A+ in my book.

still, i came on a saturday night, and there were about 10 people here.  very sad...
author: Jennifer L.

description:
"hey brah, I hit 300 on the squat rack today"
"that's awesome brah, you check out the Celtics game?"
"yeah, f@cking sucked, but I banged that chick Ashley again last night"
"..right on brah!, what's the deal with her hot friend?"
"they'll both be here later brah, maybe you can get her hammered and bang the s@it out of her"
"I got my new Audi parked outside too.."
"right on brah.."

Douche-o-rama
author: Julian M.

description:
Basically if you live in the North Side of town, you were Greek in college, and you are under 30, you'll probably love this place.  Which is to say, it's basically the exact bar that all the rest of us moved to San Francisco to get away from.   

I don't have much to add detail wise to other comments - everything people are saying is spot on about clientele/costs/activities.  I will say that the bartenders definitely cost them a star.  Spent a Saturday afternoon with my brother there playing bar games and watching basketball and had a good time.   When our tabs game it was just a cost, no line items.  Seemed a bit high, especially with 4 dollar beers, so I asked to see an itemized receipt.  Bartender gave me the worst kind of attitude and told me, "we don't do itemized receipts."   I can't say that I would ever go back to a place that can't provide me a list of what it's charging me for.
author: Ed F.

description:
Like an adult Chuck-E-Cheese, without the pizza. 

Loses one star for unnecessary, ridiculously-loud music, and another for having a knock-off Buck Hunter game instead of the real thing.

Great place to bring your crew of really loud, obnoxiously hammered friends. You'll fit right in.
author: jaja w.

description:
Let's just get this one bit out of the way first. This place is fratboy/douchebag central. To them, the Wreck Room is like a moth attracted to a petrochemical fire. Bright, oily, and full of energy. There is no safe "downtime" to try and experience this place. 24/7 dbags. Hell, even the bartenders say "brah."

The noise is unbearably loud. Between all of the people, the open space, and the jukebox, it's really loud. They need to do something here.

The drink prices are OK. $4 for "nicer" beers which is alright in SF, but not great.

My girl says that the ladies room is nice, but that doesn't help me. I pee standing up.

Also, they were showing the Oscars instead of college basketball. For a place that seconds as a frat house, that's kinda unacceptable. Even in San Francisco.

I love going to R-Bar during the week to get my drink on. But I don't think I'll be making it to Wreck Room again -- even though I live a block away.

Hyde Out is still the coolest bar in Nob Hill, and I'd rather pay a buck more per drink at the remodeled Zeki's than go to the Wreck Room.

Update: My girlfriend and I now have a habit of playing "spot the Wreckage" in my hood. We've dubbed the people who go to the WR as "Wreckage." So we play a game trying to see if our stereotypes are on the money. Are those 3 fratboys with the pizza box Wreckage? I don't know. Could be. Wait, one of them just jumped up to slap a sign. Yeah, that's a giveaway. Oh wait, now they've all stopped to try and hit the sign. Yep, wreckage.
author: Richard H.

description:
There's something to be said about first dates.

They can suck.

OR they can be super fun-loaded with an extra helping of "bring it!" when you show up to places like The Wreck Room.

On the weekends I've heard the place is packed so tight they use the pool table for a drink station. But roll in on a Monday night and the place is all yours. Add a little Monday Night Football on the screens and I may have just died and gone to Bar Heaven. 

So not only is there pool (which I kicked his a** in), there's also shuffle board (again, a** kicked), darts (ok this one I may have choked a little), basketball game and a juke box. Life. Is. Good. 

And not only because I'm a winner. :)
author: Stephanie J.

description:
this place is pretty cool, the bartenders are friendly and somehow always seem to remember me. when it comes to a refil the bartenders have pretty good timing on asking me if i'd like another. the only thing i really hate about this place which is a problem amungst most popular san francisco bars, filling this place so far past capacity on weekends. Now i'm fully aware that a bar will never be the roomiest of places but there is no denying when a bar is far past its max capasity and this bar along with most break that max capasity limit.
aside from that this place on week days and game days is pretty fun but mostly on Jets game days as this is a Jets bar.
author: Cescilia A.

description:
Oh how I yearn for the simple days.  I was a young, impressionable, 27 year old, Polk Street Station was still in business and I took a shady little bar called Nob Hill Tavern for granted.  It was just the perfect spot, plenty of pool tables, not too crowded, awesome jukebox.  The kind of place you could duck out and enjoy a couple cold ones away from the masses while listening to some Stevie Ray.

3 years later those days are gone.  My optimism has been overtaken by cynicism, I'm convinced the venue of Polk Street Station was infested by rats since the prime location still has yet to be rented, and Nob Hill Tavern is no more.

If you had never known the nob hill tavern existed and you came here on a non crowded day you might love it.  Personally, I just can't stand it.  Theres only 1 pool table, there A dartboard and a hoopshot.  The jukebox blares top 40 now.  I'm not sure if they've changed it out or it's just a reflection of the client-el (leaning toward the latter).  Aesthetically, they've made the place look great, which sucks.  If it were a sports bar in the truest sense aka serving food and not just existing as a douche hive bar spot then it could be great.  Unfortunately that doesn't seem to be the case.  Where did you go 2007?
author: Tony S.

description:
Yessss! A bar with shuffle board!! And darts! I lived on this street for over a year and why was I not aware of this place sooner? 

I came here with my college friends, and yeah, you go to a bar to grab a drink. But its just 10x more fun when you're playing games! Beer's average in price, about $4 for a Hef. 

Atmosphere is a mix, people visiting, SF locals, good mix of people you'd wanna talk or play games with!
author: Erin M.

description:
Who says prayers aren't answered?

5 years. It took 5 years of waiting to get a bar in my neck of the woods with shuffleboard, but that day has finally come.

Wreck room is a fantastic space along California and Hyde that brings bar games and micro brews to the forefront.

It's a wide open space with plenty of seating and a long bar that allows you to not live the life of a sardine. 

Pop a shot, shuffleboard, a dart board, and an eclectic jukebox will keep you awake for the night, while outgoing bartenders keep the drinks on stand by. 

Wreck room is a welcome new joint along the Polk street corridor, and one that will gain fans quickly. 

Drop in, have a beer, and remember why living in SF is the best gift you could ever give yourself.
author: Mike K.

description:
This place is alright. It's true what they say, this place is like a nicer buckshot filled with marina type douche bags. But so WHAT?! are you seriously looking for your husband in bars/clubs? Just enjoy the attractive polo wearing scenery and have a few drinks. I like that they have some random games here.  

The drinks are expensive and very weak in my opinion. $6 + $1 tip for vodka soda (cheap vodka with some water) in a small watered down cup. Totally not worth it. Not sure why they are so expensive?...and weak?

Music is old top 40s.  

It's an ok place to just come out and chill with some friends.
author: Em F.

description:
Gotta love The Wreck Room!  Fun games, great beers on tap, good crowd, nice interior and good energy overall.

The guys of R-Bar are responsible for the Wreck Room and they know what they're doing.  

[x] darts
[x] shuffleboard
[x] pool
[x] Golden Tee
[x] punching bag game

I've never been to a Dave & Busters, but this seems to breed the same competitive and lively atmosphere.  Bar staff is always nice, too.
author: Nick C.

description: This is a fun place, I like that they have games, especially an open pool table. I would totally go back.
author: Carolina J.

description:
Went here twice when craving more of a dive-bar atmosphere. Reminds me of college in Pittsburgh. Loved it!

Not-so-expensive drinks and tons of games! Though it made me feel a little uncomfortable with how big, spacious and well-lit this "dive bar" was, I got very excited for the shuffleboard! My first time playing, and I loved it. 

Tooons of TVs for your football watching pleasure and a really chill, fratty crowd. Made tons of friends :) 

I'll definitely go again for the shuffle board .............
author: Shephalie L.

description:
definitely the coolest new bar in sf.

Two words: SHUFFLE BOARD

Did you hear me motherfucker? SHUFFLEBOARD, ok maybe it's one word, hell I don't know.

Don't hog the table. This place kicks ass, get your ass over there and drink, play, and  have a good time.

Cheers
author: erich s.

description:
I dig this place!  Great addition to the neighborhood.  Wreck Room is brand-spankin new, spacious and filled with fun.  Came here with the after-work crowd and the bar was filling up nicely for so early in the evening.  Flat-screen TVs are placed strategically throughout the large space and seating areas with tables are pocketed away, yet numerous and available.  Games include pool, shuffle board, Buckhunter and hoops. 

 Wreck Room channels Mauna Loa, Buckshot and McTeagues...if that gives you a feel for the size, layout, crowd and available entertainment.  The size of Wreck Room makes it favorable for me; this is a great space and I'm excited to see how it develops.  This is definitely a bar I would put on your radar.  I really enjoy going to Zeki's Bar and Encore karaoke and Wreck Room will definitely be added to the circuit from here on out.
author: Kerry D.

description: The Wreck Room is a pretty cool place if you're looking for a chill bar. Their drinks are relatively cheap and the bar itself is spacious with a long counter and a bunch of tables where you can just enjoy your drinks and hang out with friends. What makes this bar even better is the fact that they have arcade games like skee ball and basketball and even shuffleboard! Pretty fun place.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Welcome to the neighborhood!!

1. games!!!
2. friendly bartenders
3. good beer
4. huge space
5. very cute ladies restroom
6. good jukebox tunes, teach me how to dougie came on and people all over the bar started dancing. it was great!

one downside - the dbags were out in full force on a saturday afternoon/evening but that won't deter me from coming again and again

love it!
author: Kiristen R.

description: Always fun. Great for big groups and watching sports.
author: megan l.

description:
Lively bar a couple blocks from my house. The ambiance at Wreck Room is always fun and loud with people chilling by the bar or playing pool. There's also a shuffleboard table (it looks fun!) but the wait for that is usually pretty long. I also embarrassed myself by playing the basketball shooting game. But people here were nice and encouraging and no one made fun of me despite how bad I was!

For the men out there, lift some weights before you come. There's a punching machine game here for you to show off your muscles. Apparently my friend came here before, scored some high points at the punching game, and within seconds, girls were flocking to him.
author: Carolyn W.

description: Great place to be when it's not packed! So I would steer clear on the weekend nights. It gets too crowded at miserably hot. Great on a Thursday night or weekend day when they have special events like beer Olympics.
author: Vishal V.

description: Love my wreck room. Fun, games, good crowd, fast service, and cheap drinks. My only knocks is that it can get pretty hot and  sweaty in there.
author: Cameron B.

description: Pretty cool bar with adult games like shuffleboard and darts. Minus 2 stars for a D-bag bartender tho.
author: Alex G.

description: They've got some good games, especially the pop-a-shot, but on a weekend it's way too crowded to enjoy them. They might want to think about not letting so many people in so the one's already in can enjoy themselves. Or they probably don't care and just want to make as much money as possible. Guess I don't blame them, but not my problem as I won't be back...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Very spacious bar. Although it's hard to find parking, once you get inside, you just care about your sports team and cheering with fellow fans.

There are also a lot of games available, but make sure you snatch it up before some other party decides to play shuffleboard for 4 hours.

The bathroom is super dark and you can't see what you're doing so just be careful and don't pee on yourself.
author: Seiji N.

description: Great place to watch the game! Cheep beers are always a plus. Went there on a Monday to watch a hockey game and it was not busy at all.
author: Katie A.

description:
I don't know why there are so many bad reviews. It's pretty much my new favorite bar. The night we went had a pretty attractive and fun crowd. The drinks were fine, and the bartender girl was really nice, and mixed us up some fun shots. The best part is that they have games. Love it. My friend and I kicked a lot of ass at the basketball game. 

We came on a Saturday, and it was crazy packed, but that's what makes bars fun. If you want to go somewhere to sit by yourself, stay home. 

Parking sucks, but it's San Francisco so that's a given. 

The only flaw and the reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is it gets really, really hot and stuffy, the fans they have aren't really adequate enough to keep it cool. 

It's like a much nicer Buckshot...ish.

Plus they take credit cards. I can't stand it when bars don't.
author: Brittany P.

description: Packed on weekends yet the bartenders keep the low priced drinks flowing. :)
author: Peter B.

description:
Came here for the first time the other night, and wow, they have games here for the drunkies to play!

When I came here one night, these two girls were just jamming by themselves to the music and it was such a sight to see! Too adorable.  

I thought I would be good at that punching bag game but I totally sucked.  The guy that played before me punched 900 something while I only punched 300 something.  Totally embarrassing.

My friend totally loves the basketball game and all of us hogged for a lot of the night.  It's a pretty fun game and a good workout to sweat off the alcohol that one has been drinking.
author: Tina L.

description:
