Pretty cool dive bar with lots of different games and specialty drinks. We came here on a Friday night to celebrate a birthday and had a really fun time with just the girls. There's not much of a wait at the bar (a plus!) and plenty of room to just chill. 

Because the games were pretty much occupied.. we didn't get to really play any of the games! Oh well! Next time!
author: Jennie P.

description:
Nice work!  I'd never been to the place that used to be here, but even so, it's clear that the new owners did some major work to create the Wreck Room.  They've got a huge, spacious bar, a ton of places to sit, and table shuffleboard!   Plus, the space looks great.  It's a sports bar through and through, but you'll be impressed with how tasteful they've set up the bar and decorated the place.

The Wreck Room definitely fills a need for a big sports bar on this side of Nob Hill.  It's a great after-work place and one that I hope to visit many times!
author: Tim N.

description: Fun place to hang out on a wednesday night.
author: Danny D.

description:
The place is HUGE
They have shuffleboard (no sand though? wtf. go buy some sand)
The back area looks like some rich guys game room.
The ladies bathroom is awesome.
The crowd was a really weird mix. Maybe I've been going out in the mission too much, hanging out with all those crazy hipsters...who knows.
author: Skye W.

description: I was glad I came here for the Oregon vs. Oregon State civil war game because the place was filled with Duck fans so it was a great crowd to watch the game with! Drinks were reasonably priced and the crowd was young. I would definitely come here again!
author: Emily O.

description: Um no thanks. I don't know what I was thinking with my original review. Ugh, whenever my friends want to go here I desperately try to opt out. If I do end up getting dragged here, I end up feeling bored, annoyed, and try to find a way to sneak back to my apt. Solution: get my single girl friends drunk, point them towards somewhat decent looking (loud obnoxious) guys, and peace out. Works like a charm!
author: Sonya D.

description:
A lot of room to have fun at Wreck Room. Even has some elbow room on packed weekend nights. Congratulations on a much needed face-lift to the old Nob Hill Tavern.  Wreck Room is clearly living up to its potential and has been added to my list of favorite SF watering holes.

P.S. If you're looking to boost your confidence in Pop-A-Shot, play Chris. He is no good.
author: Brooks A.

description:
Great hangout place.

Came here on a Thursday night and it wasn't too super pack but still had a good crowd.  They have several TV screens and ample amount of tables.  Also, a variety of arcade games, basketball, table hockey and a few others, along with a pool table and darts.

The only drawback is the neighborhood itself is a difficult place to find parking.

Quick note to the ladies, the lady's room was pretty clean and by far, not grimey the night I went.
author: Mimi P.

description: Good mix of people and lots of games to play. Literally, they have a ton of amusement games. Like a Hot Shot basketball game, foosball, darts, a pinball machine, and the mini shuffleboard. Wreck Room usually has some decent looking girls for SF standards. This is one of my favorite bars in the Nob Hill/Polk Street area.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Service: 3-Stars 
Ambiance: 3-Stars 
Entertainment: 3.5-Stars
Worth the Money:  2-Stars
Overall Evaluation:  3-Stars

Items Ordered: Mixed drink, shot, beer

Quality of Service: * * *
The quality of service was mediocre.  They are just bartenders and my drink orders weren't complex. They turned and burned orders at a medium pace.

Ambiance: * * *
The place was clean and had decent music but the gender ratio was off, 75% men to 25% women.  Nothing spectacular.

Entertainment: * * * -
The place has a plethora of great games but no area for live music. Shuffleboard, basketball, arcade golf, and a punching bag for the popped collar crowd. No live music is unfortunate.

Worth the Money: * * 
I got charged about $7 per drink.  That's excessive. C'mon fellas, you only have dudes in the place, cut us a break.  Save those prices to the clubs or places where they have to pay for a live band.

Overview: * * *
Fun for a while.  Next time I will get only one drink, play two games, and move on.  This place is a post pre-party stop and nothing more.
author: G. Lue D.

description:
Cold beers, non-Top 40 music, skeeball, darts, shootout, pool, the punching machine game thingy...Wreck Room is like an adult arcade with drinks.

My only gripe is Wreck Room gets a bit hot when it's crowded. Come early for some drinks and then move to somewhere on Polk once the crowd rolls in.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Came for the first time on Saturday night for a birthday party and am loving it! Here's why:

* Huge space - there were multiple large groups and there was still plenty of space to mingle

* Ladies bathroom is awesome - clean, no lines, and a huge mirrored room for "primping"

* GAMES! - A classier alternative to buckshot, but still has shuffle board, pop a shot, arcade games, darts, etc!

* Cheap beers

* Great location - just a few blocks from dinner on Polk
author: Meagan C.

description: Ended up here during a pub crawl that we weren't on, it was super crowded (not their fault but I was looking for a relaxing, quiet bar!). There's not a lot of seating (but maybe they took it out because of the pub crawl?) but the drinks are pretty good and well priced. It was a little more "college bar-y" than I was expecting.
author: Amber M.

description:
As you can tell from other reviews they have awesome Carnival/Arcade type games, which is a plus. The punching machine is over priced but extremely addictive, and frankly doesn't do my punching ability justice. If you consider yourself a man (or buff chick) you will end up spending five dollars trying to punch the daylights out of the stupid punching bag. It is a love hate relationship type game.  

Drinks are priced somewhat reasonable per San Francisco standards. 

Atmosphere is by far the best part of this bar. Young 21-25 crowd most the time, which suits my silly 23 year old ass perfectly.
author: Maxwell P.

description:
Cool place and fun hangout for a large group. Easy to find and park . Fun games to play like shuffle board, darts, billiards. Young alcohol driven atmosphere that you would expect and demand from the looks of the place. My only negative was that the pool table was position in an area that wasn't conducive some shots and the table seemed a bit weathered if not lumpy.

All in all I had a great experience and would go back in a heart beat given my ability to gather at least 12 of my friends.
author: Jason C.

description: I came to this place for the first time to watch the Superbowl, I knew it would be packed and I honestly didn't mind. However the tv''s were on the smaller side and are mounted high up next to the sealing which made it hard to see and made my neck hurt pretty fast. I ended up leaving and going to another bar to finish up the game.
author: Vlad M.

description:
Went here last weekend, what a fun and different way to go out! No cover, no line, no hassle to get in. Definitely a sports bar type vibe, what with the flat screens everywhere, but there's also something different about Wreck Room. It has a shuffleboard table, a video game and a basketball machine that draws crowds and encourages mingling and socializing.

Plenty of space throughout the place and open feel. Crowd is reasonably decent looking by SF standards which, let's be honest about it, are not as high as say, NYC, LA, Vegas or even Scottsdale.

Would encourage them to add more games (perhaps table games like battleship or checkers?) since the few games they have fill up quickly. But if you're in the mood for something different from the norm in the Nob Hill area, you won't be disappointed.
author: Sebastian L.

description:
Have you ever been to the basement of a fraternity house?  Well this place is almost exactly like that but much better and even more fun!

Don't expect to have many dep conversations here, the music requires dancing or you're too busy watching the game, playing shuffle board, darts or pop-a-shot.

I just wish they served chili and had some logo'd swag!
author: Jim K.

description: Great place to start the night off or to head to for happy hour. Darts, ski ball, pool, basketball. Its almost like a shitty version of Dave and Busters but better clientele of people.  Mostly groups here, I even saw some tall slightly douchey inspector gadget looking guy make a bet that a girl couldnt hit his $20 dollar bill three times in a row on the dart board.  Well, the girl won 20 bucks and everyone seemed happy.  Good crowd of fun loving young professionals every time I'm here.
author: David D.

description: I went here with a friend on a Sunday night, it was pretty empty...which was perfect for playing games. I'd say the bar games were kind of pricey, but the staff was really cool (Scotty) and they had a ton of TVs for the games that were on.
author: Vernon W.

description: I wonder why there aren't more bars like this.  Sometimes sitting around, talking and drinking can get boring.  The Wreck Room has a pool table, arcade basketball hoop, skeeball, shuffle board, and dart board to liven things up.  I love competition, especially after throwing a few back, so I thoroughly enjoyed kicking my friends' asses in the aforementioned activities.  I went on a Saturday afternoon, so it wasn't so packed.  I can imagine it not being as fun if there are too many people in the way.  The music was also on point.  A mix of hip hop classics and new ish.  They also have mutliple flat screen tvs, showing different sports.  I have to agree with the other comments about this place being a sausage fest though, which is why I have it at 4 stars and not 5.
author: Saeed E.

description:
a quick run down...

-dive bar
-games
-juke box
-marina douches
-disproportionate ratio of male/female
-$6 guiness
-semi clean bathrooms
-music can be heard in the bathroom
-roomy
-bartendar flashed hairy nipples

good times.  mainly bc of the company i was with.  couldve done without items 4 and 10.
author: Sally T.

description: Decent place to get a drink. A few of my friends always have their birthday parties here. It does get crowded so drinks can be hard to get. That is why you double fist. They need to keep the windows open or install an air conditioning system. It gets really hot in their so leave your jacket at home. They take cards which is nice.
author: Darius A.

description:
I wish I could give a 4.5. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is because the music was louder then I wanted it to be. But you know what, some people like it like that and that's cool. What can I say, i'm a conversationalist. 

The bartenders were nice and let us try beer that we had questions about.
There were 10 or so beers on tap, and a pretty solid few shelves of what I'd call good liquor. 
 
I only got around to playing super shoot or whatever the basketball game is called, and shuffle board. 

If you're a huge shuffle board fanboy note that the table has a slight glide headed west. I personally think shuffle board should have built in slants like that. 

The folks in the bar were there to party, watch basketball (or other sports) and generally have a good time. I'm glad to see a large bar with a lot of TV's open up in the neighborhood.
author: Whit S.

description: A wannabe fun dive bar that's really a douche-bag filled dump with faux hipster-chic ambiance. I don't know about the men's bathroom (you'll have to ask the rest of the sausage fest) but the women's bathroom is dark, dank and filthy and the bartender is useless.  I'd like to say something nice, but I think I've already shared most of the highlights.
author: Soph H.

description: Good beer, good prices, good sounding jukebox setup-they actually worked the space so the music sounds great! Clean environment and good staff-unpretentious,cool place.You feel ok here,even if you are an older guy like me haha. Recommended.
author: Mag N.

description: The bouncer is a prick, I'm surprised management let's this guy represent their business. He turned away an entire group I was with because one of my friends "appeared" drunk. Really? He had only had a few drinks that night, but that's not the issue. It's a bar. That's what they're for. C'mon.
author: Todd B.

description: Decent spot on the weeknights, but I will never show my face here on a weekend again. It is either overrun by obnoxious chest pumping bros from god knows where, or a pack of equally as obnoxious Ducks fans (sorry Ducks fans but it's true). Bartenders are awesome though and the games a definitely a plus.
author: Eric H.

description: One of the best bars in the city! Fun games, good drink deals and an great overall environment. This has become my go to.
author: Matt K.

description: I spent about six hours "researching" this place yesterday and I must say it is pretty awesome,  Wreck Room is basically everything great about R Bar (tall cans of Coors Light, good music, good people, super nice owner) with really nice restrooms (I didn't wait in line once, this is a huge plus to me), a bunch of games, flat screens and tons of room to move around.  I came here for a birthday party with about 40 people, we took up a small portion of the bar, it is a great bar for group events.
author: S H.

description: Have you ever been to the basement of a fraternity house?  Well this place is slightly better in that it doesn't serve Natty Light and you have to pay for your beer.  Beyond that it's pretty much the same.  Don't expect to have many conversations here, the music requires shouting.
author: Beau G.

description:
love this place! it's got the makings of a dive bar (think hearth on geary) but super upscale. dressed up boys playing arcade basketball, shuffleboard, darts (only 1 dart board tho) and on a classy burgundy felt pool table. what more could you ask for?
we did go fairly early - around 7 on a Wednesday, so didn't experience the whole "bro" scene..

plenty of space at the bar. plenty of seating everywhere, too.
awesome gin & tonic.
super friendly bartenders (allowed us to taste a drink before ordering).
clean ass bathrooms.

OH and for some reason, the jukebox already had 50+ credits available that night.. im sure that didn't last long, though.
author: Rica R.

description: As of right now, I like this place. It's always busy and the bartenders are awesome!
author: Kissy F.

description: Pretty awesome chill bar. Great for large groups, watching sports, cheap drinks and lots of games (darts, pool, electronic bball, etc.). Not sure why people are calling this a dive - perhaps my standards are lower than others bc I def do not see this as a dive - it's just a really cool, comfy bar to hang out and have some fun with friends.
author: Adrienne C.

description: Great selection of beer and fun games to boot! Similar to the buckshot but the crowd isn't necessarily a college crowd.
author: Brian A.

description: Pretty cool spot...Decent drinks, always have good sports on TV, and of course the games are cool.  But this place is super popular and gets wayy crowded which can suck cuz it gets flippin hot in there.  If you're really trying to play pool, you wanna avoid this spot...if you're trying to get drunk and play some shuffleboard--this is the spot.
author: Ryan H.

description: Fun time with friends after work. Decent prices for drinks. Nothing fancy. Wouldn't go out of my way to come back here, but there are sports and arcade-type games so if that's your thing, this is your place.
author: christine c.

description: . Love it here. i live in the marina, and well some of my friends aren't personally in love with my hood so we meet in the middle and play in nob hill more often than not. The bartenders are great and have amazing personalities!! its a really fun environment that attracts a great crowd. ive never been let down with the time and money spent at the wreck room.
author: Denniz M.

description: Finally got in here on a night when it wasn't too packed and had a blast.  The only other place in town I can think of that compares in the Buckshot.  It's nice to mask your alcoholism with games such as shoot a hoop and punch-o-meter.
author: Corey V.

description: I must've had a blast because I can't remember a thing!
author: Chio S.

description: Easy, huge space and mostly men here.  Ladies, stop by
author: kim k.

description: Great bar! I was more than excited to hear there was a newish bar in town a couple months ago after effectively exhausting Polk Street. It's close to my house, so I tend to find myself at Wreck Room somewhat frequently. It has a fun atmosphere with arcade games galore. I also found that it is a rad place to watch a Giants game. Awesome location, great bartenders, and fun place brah!
author: Melinda S.

description: I've never been treated so poorly by a bouncer in my life (the ginger bouncer, in case anyone from management reads this). Rude, and arrogant. I avoid this place. Service is awful.
author: Casey V.

description: I love this bar. It is only two blocks away from where my bf lives and the bartenders remember your face. It was my third time there in between each time it was a month or so. I love how they make my long island strong. =) The only bad thing is it can get a little stuffy. They need more fans to circulate the beer air.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Went here last Saturday for my birthday and it was great! Plenty of room and tables for all of my friends and they had dice so we could play 1/4/24 all night which was awesome (I came home with some extra pocket change-my friends like to gamble!). Friendly service and awesome place. I'll be back
author: Chelsea M.

description: A marina sports bar in polk gulch!  Not the 'coolest' place in town but fun and always busy.  Good times.
author: Jonas C.

description: Hands down my favorite bar. Ever. This bar is amazing. They've got tons of fun games to keep you entertained, lots of seating if that's your thing, friendly bartenders and pretty girls. What more could you ask for?
author: Mike R.

description: Great place to go and get some bar games out of your system.  They have darts, pool, punching bag machine, basketball game, shuffleboard (although not a standard table), pretty good seating, and a bunch of beers on tap.  They used to have Golden Tee... not sure if it's moved or has been completely replaced by the new Photo Booth.  Anyways, when it gets crowded it can be a challenge to order a drink but otherwise is a great time, esp for gamers.  Good place to watch NFL games too....
author: Robert S.

description: Good spot for non-sport sports (i.e. pool, shuffleboard, arcade bball, darts) and the pbrs and silver bullets flow all night. Not a great bar to watch games ironically as the tvs aren't well positioned but it will do. Love the crowd and bartenders are solid.
author: Joe C.

description: Merghhh I am so conflicted about this place. First time I went I loved it so much I went back the next day. It's like a dive bar minus the grunge. They have shuffleboard, and that basketball shooting game, darts, etc, it's a nice open area, and the crowd was like ex-frat boy who is "so over that" but then still kind of/really misses it. As much as I hate to admit it, those are my people. Unfortunately that was the early days before everyone knew about it. Saturday night was packed, hot, sticky, and the bad/unabashed kind of fratty. Felt like a typical sports bar where you had to scream to make conversation with your friends. Sadddd because this place had so much promise. Let's be real though - I'll probably still go back now and again.
author: Joanne S.

description: This place is a great addition to the hood! Great service and plenty of space. I just may drink here for the next 30 days.
author: Tommy W.

description: you play Guns n Roses on the Jukebox, and have cute bartenders, and get me hammered I'm a happy camper. Laid back vibe which I love. Into it
author: Lauren V.

description:
great bar! really fun as long as you aren't looking for a low-key quiet dive-y place :)

good beers on tap, interesting mix of people, mostly younger college friends. awesome fun games, pool, darts, shuffleboard, etc. 

it gets packed and hot, but thats to be expected at this type of place. definitely fun for dancing and playing games, not talking.
author: Rachael B.

description:
I'm a fan. Originally there were some credit card issues, but they completely fixed the problem and fast! 

Great bar, great owner- wonderful CS. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
author: Katrina B.

description: See, I told you it would get better. I ordered a different drink (vodky tonic) and it was delicious. I played a game of hoops and it was a grand ol' time. And I took a little more time to notice the decor, which was even really nice in the bathroom. Wreck Room, you're movin' on up.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
I recently moved to SF from Denver and was immediately taken to the bars in the Marina for my first weekend.  These bars were too preppy/swanky and overcrowded for my style. 

I live in the neighborhood and ventured into the Wreck Room and found what I had been hoping to find in SF. A bar with tvs, games, friendly people and music. I met up with some friends, watched  March Madness games and sipped on $3 PBRs. 

I will definitely go back here! The music could be turned down a bit when it's still daylight but overall good place. 

I'm sold.
author: Sarah H.

description: This place is amazing.  Lots of hot guys, fun games, clean nice decor, good beer selection.  It does get packed because it's so great but just get there early and you're good to go.  Obviously if you aren't in to the "marina crowd" than you probably won't like it, but I am a Pac Heights honey myself and I am into the Marin/Pac Heights/Russian Hill crowd.  I think this place is a great addition to the Northern SF party scene.
author: Daniella S.

description: I love dive bars as much as the next guy. I dig sticky floors, crappy jukeboxes, pool tables stuck in tight spots, and pee party style bathrooms. The Wreck Room succeeds admirably on all accounts! We had an unofficial holiday party last night and other than a real pain-in-the-ass parking situation (certainly not the Wreck Room's fault), it got off to a great start. BUT, later on, when the place filled up, it was difficult to move around the bar and nearly impossible to get a drink. Again, this isn't the fault of the bartenders who are friendly and attentive, but just an issue of logistics and a space that's way overfilled. I'm not sure I liked the crowd that much. There were some douchebag guys who were lacking manners and a few people who were throwing some weird looks, but I'll just tally that up to the instant jerk issue that appears when you add alcohol to some people. I'd come back here again, but only if we managed to rent the place out and we could provide our own music instead of the mediocrity on the jukebox.
author: Jason W.

description: We watched the 49ers in the NFC Championship here - it was a great place to do it.  The place was packed and the staff handled it beautifully!  We will definitely come back when we are in town next time!  Thanks for the memories!
author: Carol H.

description: Ended up at this Bar last Saturday after a big group bday dinner.  If you're searching for a not too crowded bar with fun games and a young crowd, this may be a good spot.  The only serious downfall (besides fancying myself way older than everybody else - the crowd looked YOUNG) was that the place was seriously, seriously HOT. If I'm sweating in a bar, I want it to be because I'm dancing, not because somebody failed to keep in mind that semi-crowded rooms full of (mostly male) energy tend to get hot. After trying to catch up with friends while sweltering, I finally decided to take off - right around midnight (which, coincidentally, is the ideal time for me to turn in anyways).
author: Rachel N.

description: This place seems to draw the worst crowd you could imagine in a nice neighborhood lots of big mouth idiots drunk on cheap booze/beer looking at 2 girls sleeping at one of the tables loudest music you could find on Nob Hill I am moving out :SF is getting the NY treatment let s get out of here too many face book apple Google firemen police recruits ( I saw a bunch of them getting out of a car right in front))
author: dd k.

description: One word, NOISE. I live on the fourth floor of the building that the Wreck Room is located in on the ground floor. The thumping from their overly loud music is preventing me from sleeping without earplugs. I can only imagine how it is for the people on the second and third floors of the hotel.
author: Michael K.

description:
What an awful, terrible, waste of time.  Horrible experience on multiple occasions. The regular cliental are annoying to be around, many fitting the stereotypical "bro" archetype. The drinks are incredibly overpriced.  Even the service is terrible.  It took an average of seven minutes to get one drink on a week day, when it wasn't even that crowded.  The service was no help whatsoever.  After a drunken slop tried stealing my overpriced drink, neither the bar staff nor the "bouncer" helped me in my efforts to get the drunk thief out of the bar.  The runners of this so-called business do not wish to help the honest, paying patrons in lieu of better serving creeper, drunken criminals.  And their games, which should be their one redeeming factor, are always occupied, most of the time by these irritating archetypes aforementioned.  I would highly suggest drinking at ANY other bar in the Polk area, even "brother bar" R Bar, which is at least run half decently in comparison.

Wreck room is a total wreck and a complete waste of time and money. I can't wait to see it go out of business.
author: Jasper K.

description: It's nice to go to a bar with games and activities but isn't a total dive.  The basketball hoop was a fun surprise.  Bring change!
author: Danielle B.

description: I was at the Wreck Room on 3/5/11 and the bar was unbearably hot. I ended up leaving because I was so uncomfortable. The venue was decent and I appreciate that there are games (including shuffleboard), but for the love of God turn down the heat!
author: S O.

description:
there are def a lot of bros here. i think i was one of 3 chicks in the whole bar.  i went here once to watch a giants game. ive been to a few of my neighborhood bars but this time i just decided to go up another block or two. there are a lot of games in here. 
-2 stars because of service. eventhough i love the bouncer who shares my last name the bartenders...eh not so much. maybe i am just used to going to bars where they actually serve cute girls. i think i waited at least 10 minutes to get a drink. and there was no one else at the bar ordering drinks. the bartenders were too engaged with talkin to their friends i guess they must have forgot they were still running a business. i tend to drink and tip more when people actually pay attention to me. i work in the service industry so i know how important it is to make sure your guests are well taken care of. ive always said "tips are earned not given" because i always do my best to give the best service. i guess ill go here again to watch games. only because its not a sleazey as the rest of the bars on polk lower than cali. just next time when i walk in...please give me a drink.
author: Ashley H.

description: This is a great bar with lots of cool games. The bartenders here are awesome especially Rachel. I grabbed a drink after work recently and was so excited to find pop a shot and shuffleboard.
author: Jamie B.
